    modules/data/ivx-io/enhancer.inputs.js

    import {iVXioInputButtonEnhancer} from './enhancer.inputs.buttons.js';

/**
 * Enhances input data from previous versions of these iVXjs settings to
 * work with the most current version of iVXjs's input state. The previous version
 * had two distinct input states -- Single and Multiple Input State -- which 
 * had different displays. iVXjs has only one so this will enhance by the type
 * of input state as previously defined. 
 */
export class iVXioInputEnhancer {

    /**
     * Defines the former inputs, the current iVXio experience 
     * and the input state type this data comes from to 
     * enhance.
     * 
     * @param {array} rawInputs - inputs to be enhanced.
     * @param {iVXioExperience} experience - iVXio experience 
     * @param {string} stateType - single or multiple state type.
     */
    constructor(rawInputs, experience, stateType) {
        /**
         * Current inputs that need enhanced to work with 
         * iVXjs
         * @type {Array} 
         */
        this.rawInputs = rawInputs;

        /**
         * iVXio experience object to help define various
         * input enhancements.
         * @type {iVXioExperience}
         */
        this.experience = experience;

        /**
         * Determines if the old state type is multiple inputs
         * or single input.
         * @type {string}
         */
        this.stateType = stateType;

        /**
         * Handles all buttons enhancements.
         * @type {iVXioInputButtonEnhancer}
         */
        this.iVXioInputButtonEnhancer = iVXioInputButtonEnhancer;
    }

    /**
     * Maps the default type for iVXio input's single  
     * input state to a valid type just in case a iVXjs 
     * input  type is missing.
     * @type {object}
     */
    get singleInputDefaultTypes() {
        return {
            "TextShort": "text",
            "TextMedium": "text",
            "TextLarge": "text",
            "Email": "email",
            "Telephone": "text",
            "Url": "url",
            "Number": "number",
            "Options": "buttons",
            "ComboBox": "buttons",
            "Checkbox": "buttons",
            "TextArea": "textarea",
            "Date": "date",
            "DateTime": "datetime-local"
        }

    }

    /**
     * Maps the default type for iVXio input's single  
     * input state to a valid type just in case a iVXjs 
     * input  type is missing.
     * @type {object}
     */
    get multipleInputsDefaultTypes() {
        return {
            "TextShort": "text",
            "TextMedium": "text",
            "TextLarge": "text",
            "Email": "email",
            "Telephone": "text",
            "Url": "url",
            "Number": "number",
            "Options": "options",
            "ComboBox": "options",
            "Checkbox": "checkbox",
            "TextArea": "textarea",
            "Date": "date",
            "DateTime": "datetime-local"
        }
    }

    /**
     * Consolodates all inputs maps to translate iVXio Input Displays
     * to iVXjs types
     * 
     * @type {object}
     */
    get inputDefault() {
        return {
            singleInput: this.singleInputDefaultTypes,
            multipleInputs: this.multipleInputsDefaultTypes
        }
    }

    /**
     * All inputs enhanced to work with iVXjs input classes
     * 
     * @type {Array}
     */
    get inputs() {

        this.rawInputs.forEach((inputInfo, index) => {

            this.runInputEnhancement(inputInfo, index)
        });

        return this.rawInputs;
    }

    /**
     * Retrieves the iVXio's input data by the provided
     * inputKey to help enhancement.
     * 
     * @param {string} inputKey - the key for this iVXio input
     * @return {object} input settings from this iVXio platform.
     */
    getInputData(inputKey) {

        let {inputs} = this.experience.story;
        return inputs[inputKey];
    }

    /**
     * Translates the current iVXio Display type to a valid 
     * input type based on whether it is a single, multiple or 
     * non-validated text input type.
     * 
     * @param {string} display - iVXio Display type
     * @param {string} type - iVXjs input type
     * @return {string} iVXjs input type corresponding to this iVXio Display 
     * type.
     */
    getDefaultType(display, type) {

        let convertTypes = ['Email', 'Url', 'Date', 'DateTime', 'TextArea', 'Number'];

        let shouldConvertToType = convertTypes.indexOf(display) >= 0 && (type === 'text' || type === 'input');

        if (!type || shouldConvertToType) {
            return this.inputDefault[this.stateType][display];
        }

        return type;

    }

    /**
     * Enhances an input from the old iVXio input data structure to the 
     * new iVXjs input data structure to create a valid iVXjs input. Once 
     * enhanced, it overwrites the rawInput at the index.
     * 
     * @param {object} inputInfo - current inputInfo that will be enhanced.
     * @param {number} index - index of this input in the inputs array.
     */
    runInputEnhancement(inputInfo, index) {

        let inputData = this.getInputData(inputInfo.inputKey) || {};
        let {settings = { width: inputInfo.width }} = inputInfo;
        let {display} = inputData;
        let {stateType} = this;
        let {inputKey } = inputInfo;
        let type = this.getDefaultType(display, inputInfo.type);

        inputInfo = this.addMissingInputData(inputInfo, inputData, type);

        inputInfo.settings = settings;
        inputInfo.settings.showLabel = this.rawInputs.length > 1;

        this.rawInputs[index] = inputInfo;

    }

    /**
     * Adds any additional input information that is required
     * by various iVXio displays and iVXjs types.
     * 
     * @param {object} inputInfo - current iVXjs input settings.
     * @param {object} inputData - iVXio's input data 
     * @return {object} - updated inputInfo with additional information 
     * filled. 
     */
    addAdditionalInfo(inputInfo, inputData) {
        let {type} = inputInfo;
        let {display} = inputData;

        if (!inputInfo.attributes) inputInfo.attributes = {};

        switch (type) {
            case "buttons":
                if(inputInfo.buttons) break;
                if (display === "Checkbox") {
                    inputData.options = [
                        {
                            "value": "yes",
                            "display": "Yes"
                        }, {
                            "value": "no",
                            "display": "No"
                        }
                    ]
                }

                if (display === 'ComboBox') {
                    inputData.options = inputData.options.map((thisOption, index) => {
                        return {
                            value: thisOption.value,
                            display: thisOption.value
                        }
                    });
                    
                }
                inputInfo.buttons = new this.iVXioInputButtonEnhancer(inputData, inputInfo).buttons;
                break;
            case "options":
                let {options} = inputData;
                inputInfo.options = options;
        }

        switch (display) {
            case "TextShort":
                inputInfo.attributes.maxlength = "64"
                break;
            case "TextMedium":
                inputInfo.attributes.maxlength = "128";
                break;
            case "TextLarge":
                inputInfo.attributes.maxlength = "256";
                break;
            case "ComboBox":
                let {options : comboBoxOptions = []} = inputData;
                comboBoxOptions = comboBoxOptions.map((thisOption, index) => {
                    return {
                        value: thisOption.value,
                        display: thisOption.value
                    }
                });
                inputInfo.options = comboBoxOptions;
        }

        return inputInfo;

    }

    /**
     * Takes old input information from iVXio and adds any information
     * that is needed for iVXjs.
     * 
     * @param {object} oldInputData - information from the previous verision
     * @param {object} iVXjsinputData - current iVXjs input information
     * @param {string} type - iVXjs input type.
     * @return {object} - valid iVXjs object with all necessary information.
     */
    addMissingInputData(oldInputData, iVXjsInputData, type) {
        let {inputKey} = oldInputData;
        let {id = inputKey, name = inputKey, key = inputKey, required, submitText} = oldInputData;
        let newInputInfo = oldInputData;
        let {attributes = {}, name: inputName, labelHTML, label = iVXjsInputData.name } = iVXjsInputData;


        newInputInfo.id = id;
        newInputInfo.key = key;
        newInputInfo.name = name;
        newInputInfo.labelHTML = labelHTML;
        newInputInfo.label = label;
        newInputInfo.attributes = attributes;
        newInputInfo.attributes.required = required;
        newInputInfo.type = type;
        

        this.addAdditionalInfo(newInputInfo, iVXjsInputData);

        return newInputInfo;
    }



};
    Generated by ESDoc(0.4.7)
